RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 1 1M Turf CR: 94. Allowance Purse 95000. (UP TO $16,530 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners O f A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile on the Main Track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SWEETLOU'SGOTACES four wide in pursuit down the backstretch settled in mid pack, tucked to the two path through the turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch and closed well to just get up in the final strides to the wire. CADENCIA prompted early and then dueled in hand along the inside of FREDDYMO FACTOR, shook off her main rival near the quarter pole and got set down spinning just off the inside into upper stretch, edged clear under a drive to the eighth pole, dug in under growing late threat and was nailed on the wire. WINGS LIKE EAGLES settled just off the inside near the rear of the field and pulled against the bit early on while under reserve, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and altered out around a injured rival nearing that station, angled six wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild kick to secure the show honors. FORTINENO (IRE) just off the inside just off the pace, tucked inside half a mile from home, got let out spinning just off the inside into upper stretch and offered up mild bid. FREDDYMO FACTOR broke out at the start bumping PARTY ON GIRL, showed the way under some pressure and then dueled three then two wide with CADENCIA to her inside, got shaken off just outside the quarter pole and went four wide into upper stretch, then weakened in the drive. EXPAND THE MAP (IRE) just off the inside tracking the front from mid pack, tucked inside at the half mile pole, got given a notch with five-sixteenths to go, then got checked just after bobbling over a fallen rival near the quarter pole, altered four wide into upper stretch and was not persevered with to the finish. PARTY ON GIRL (IRE) bumped at the start by FREDDYMO FACTOR, who broke outwards, saved ground near the rear of the field, was in the midst of tipping out to the two path when forced to check and alter course around a fallen foe near the quarter pole, went six to seven wide for home and was not persevered with to the end. MASHNEE GIRL three then two wide just off the duel up front, suffered an injury and fell near the quarter pole forcing a trio of rivals to alter course and was subsequently euthanized on track.

ENTRY.NAME: Wings Like Eagles
ENTRY.OWNER: Pantofel Stable LLC Wachtel Stable and Barber Gary
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p near rear, coaxed altered near 1/4, angle 6w uppr, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Sweetlou'sgotaces
ENTRY.OWNER: Barber Gary Wachtel Stable and Twin Sports Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w pursuit, to 2p 1/2, coaxed 5/16, 5w uppr, closed well, just up

ENTRY.NAME: Cadencia
ENTRY.OWNER: Newman Roger H and Aldabbagh Omar
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled in hand ins, set down 2w 1/4p, edged clear, nailed

ENTRY.NAME: Fortineno (IRE)
ENTRY.OWNER: West Point Thoroughbreds Barker Edwin S Freeman William T and Valdes Michael
ENTRY.COMMENT: just off pace 2p, to ins 1/2, let out 2w 1/4p, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Expand the Map (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2p, to ins 1/2, bobbled, checked near 1/4, not persevered

ENTRY.NAME: Freddymo Factor
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, dueled 3-2w, shaken off, 4w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Party On Girl (IRE)
ENTRY.OWNER: Dubb Michael Weisbord Bradley and Kisber Michael E
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, saved grd near rear. checked, altered near 1/4p

ENTRY.NAME: Mashnee Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-2w off duel, suffered injury, fell near 1/4p, euthanized

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Astoria S. BELMONT PARK RACE 2 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 89. Stakes Purse 150000. FOR FILLIES, TWO-YEARS-OLD. Non-Lasix Race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $150 each which should accompany the nomination; $750 to pass the entry box and an additional $750 to start. For h orses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $750 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to f ourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. NYRA will award $2,000 to all declared starters ($1,000 to the trainer and $1,000 to the owner) and a shipping bonus of $1,000 will be credited to the owners account for horses tha t are not stabled at a NYRA track (Belmont/Saratoga). Any horse that is placed on the Vets list or poor performance list will be ineligible for all awards. Weight, 122 lbs. Non winners of a race other than claiming or starter allowed 2 lbs. A trophy will
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CLOSING ACT brushed with a foe just after the start, was urged along on the outside, went four then three wide on the turn, gained to make a bid coming to the quarter-pole, took over the lead in upper stretch, shook clear under a right-handed crop into the final furlong and drew away under strong urging. UNION SUIT was hustled to the front, showed the way under pressure from her outside, vied inside on the turn, shook clear at the seven-sixteenths pole, lost the advantage to the winner under urging in upper stretch, dropped back into the final furlong then moved out and proved no match for the winner while clear for the place. LIVING MAGIC brushed with a rival just after the break, was squeezed back between horses early, went two then three wide on the turn, came four wide into the stretch, gained while remaining on her inside lead in the drive and secured the show. GOLDEN GHOST (GB) pressed the pace on the outside of the leader, vied in the two path on the turn, dropped back near the seven-sixteenths, chased into the stretch and tired. DONATE LIFE chased the pace, dropped from the three path to the rail on the turn, climbed into the kickback in the vicinity of the five-sixteenths and retreated.

ENTRY.NAME: Union Suit
ENTRY.OWNER: Eclipse Thoroughbred Partners Madaket Stables LLC and Highlight Thoroughbreds
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,pace inside foe,ins turn,clear7/16,headed3/16,no match

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Ghost (GB)
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed outside leader,2p,dropped back 7/16,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Donate Life
ENTRY.OWNER: HnR Nothhaft Horse Racing LLC and Schoenthal Phil
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace,3path-rail turn,climbed kickback5/16,retreated

ENTRY.NAME: Living Magic
ENTRY.COMMENT: brshd after brk,pinched back early,2-3p turn,4p1/4,gained

ENTRY.NAME: Closing Act
ENTRY.COMMENT: brshd after brk,urged outside,4-3p turn,lead3/16,clear,driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 3 1 3/8M Inner turf CR: 96. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 100000. INNER TURF (UP TO $17,400 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $62,500. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Since December 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $62,500 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% AftercareA ssessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PARNAC (FR) just off the inside tracking from mid pack, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled four wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive and was up in the final jumps to prevail. STRIKINGLY SPUN broke out at the start bumping SHAD NATION, attended that foe in closest aim just off the inside patiently handled until set down taking the two path into upper stretch, rallied to take command a furlong out drifting in very slightly, dug in under threat and was caught in the final strides to the wire. FEDERALIST PAPERS saved ground at the tail of the field, remained patiently handled until set down taking the inside route into upper stretch, had a clear lane just off the fence initially between foes and then went on through a tighter seam a furlong out as STRIKINGLY SPUN came in very slightly as SHAD NATION came out very slightly, had the rider release the right handed rein to go to a right handed crop and came in impeding SHAD NATION on the fence forcing that rival to check sharply, the rider pausing himself to look back to assess the damage done, then kept on to secure the show honors at the end. BE UP tracked the pace along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive between foes, then got outfinished in the late stages. PEACE SEEKER two to three wide in pursuit from near the rear of the field, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled four to five wide for home and offered no response. SHAD NATION got bumped at the start by STRIKINGLY SPUN, who broke outwards, established the front and showed the way in hand three then two wide, tucked inside half a mile from home, came under coaxing near the quarter pole under challenge to the outside, cut the corner into upper stretch, dug in under threat and was headed near the eighth pole, then had FEDERALIST PAPERS come inwards under a right handed crop and was forced to check sharply when impeded inside the eighth pole, couldn't recover thereafter. ENSEMBLE (IRE) two to three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, weakened. There was a Stewards' Inquiry into the stretch run. After review, the result was allowed to stand and the race was declared official.

ENTRY.NAME: Federalist Papers
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved grd at rear, ins 1/4, impeded foe ins 1/8p, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Parnac (FR)
ENTRY.OWNER: West Point Thoroughbreds and Dream With Me Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2p, coaxed 5/16, angled 4w upper, up last jumps

ENTRY.NAME: Be Up
ENTRY.OWNER: Goldfarb Sanford J and Carney Christopher L
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked ins, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, dug in betw, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Strikingly Spun
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, attended 2p, set down 2w 1/4p, up 1/8, caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Shad Nation
ENTRY.OWNER: Justice Stables LLC Madaket Stables LLC Dubb Michael and Caruso Michael J
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, in hand 3-2w, cut corner, checked, impeded ins 1/8p

ENTRY.NAME: Peace Seeker
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w near rear, coaxed 5/16, 4-5w upper, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Ensemble (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w pursuit, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 4 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 97. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 85000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $45,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Since December 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $45,000 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% AftercareAs sessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DADDY KNOWS prompted the pace on the outside, dropped back under extra left-rein guidance with three furlongs to run, was coaxed in the three path under a snug left-handed grip navigating the turn, chased in the four path into upper stretch, gained to make an outside bid near the furlong marker, took the advantage outside the sixteenth-pole, swapped back to his inside lead at the that pole and prevailed under good handling. SUNDAESWITHSANDY showed speed then set the pace, vied inside on the turn, shook clear with three furlongs to run, was put to a drive into upper stretch, came under a right-handed crop outside the furlong marker, lost the lead to the winner outside the sixteenth-pole, fought with that foe to the wire and missed while clear for the place. SIX PERCENT broke a step slow, moved in near the three-quarter pole, settled comfortably off the pace, was roused three wide on the turn, moved out in upper stretch and lacked the needed kick while clear for the show. WILD BANKER bumped with a rival at the start then was taken up with a tug of the left rein, showed speed then settled off the pace, was asked in the two path on the turn, chased into the stretch and came up empty. MASON MANIA bumped with a rival at the start then was squeezed back between foes, settled on the inside, was roused while saving ground on the turn and failed to respond. GANDY DANCING was forwardly placed on the outside, chased in the four path on the turn and capitulated. LATE NIGHT LARRY broke a step slow, was urged along at the rear, fell well behind before the half-mile pole and was pulled up then vanned off.

ENTRY.NAME: Wild Banker
ENTRY.OWNER: PlayingTheField Racing Final Turn Racing Stable LLC and Acqua Nova Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,tkn up,settled,asked 2path turn,chased,empty

ENTRY.OWNER: McClay, Thomas G. and Brown, Jr., Donald L.
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,pinched,settled,inside turn,no response

ENTRY.COMMENT: speed,pace,inside turn,clear3/8,ask1/4,headed outside1/16,missed

ENTRY.COMMENT: prompt out,drop back3/8,3p,left rein guidance,bid1/8,lead,prevail

ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow,urged along,well behind1/2,pulled up,vanned off

ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow,mvd in 3/4,settled,ask 3w turn,mvd out,clear show

ENTRY.NAME: Gandy Dancing
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly placed outside,chased 4wide turn,empty

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Jersey Girl S. BELMONT PARK RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 91. Stakes Purse 150000. FOR FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. Non-Lasix Race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $150 each which should accompany the nomination; $750 to pass the entry box and an additional $750 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $750 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided accordingly, $82,500 to the owner of the winner, $30,000 to second , $18,000 to third, $9,000 to fourth, $6,000 to fifth and $4,500 divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight 122 lbs. Non-winners of a graded sweepstake or two sweepstakes other than State-bred allowed 2 lbs.; of a sweepstake other than State- bred lifetime or two races other than maiden, claiming, starter or state-bred allowance in 2023 allowed 4 lbs. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, May 27, 2023 with 17 Original Nominations and 1 Supplement.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: L STREET LADY chased three to four paths off the inside down the backstretch until tucked inside at the nine-sixteenths, came under coaxing at the three-eighths and tipped out two then three wide at the five-sixteenths, angled four wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive rallying to issue a challenge through the final furlong taking command seventy yards from home, then inched away in the late stages. UNIFIED ALLIANCE six paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked five then four wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled in to spin three wide into upper stretch, rallied to take command at the three-sixteenths, dug in under threat and was collared with seventy yards to go while clear for the place honors. WILDHAWK coaxed from the gate, showed the way in hand three paths off the rail, remained three wide into the turn keeping both AUNT BECCA and UNIFIED ALLIANCE four and five wide respectively, had the rider sneak a peek over his left shoulder and tucked to the two path at the three-eighths, came under pressure and was placed to coaxing near the quarter pole, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, yielded the front at the three-sixteenths and weakened in the late stages. CHOCOLATE GELATO brushed the off side stall at the start, came under coaxing briefly and chased five paths off the inside, tucked to the two path into the turn before making her way to the rail three furlongs from home, came under coaxing just past the three-eighths, took the inside route into upper stretch with a clear path down inside and tipped out three then four wide at the three-sixteenths forcing AUNT BECCA to steady and paused off her heels, then weakened to the finish. AUNT BECCA four wide in aim of the front, remained four wide into the turn before tucking three wide at the three-eighths when placed to coaxing, swung three wide into upper stretch and got forced to pause and steady off the heels of CHOCLATE GELATO as that rival tipped out directly in front, then weakened through to the wire.

ENTRY.NAME: Wildhawk
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, in hand 3p, to 2p 3/8, 2w 1/4, collared 3/16, wknd lte

ENTRY.NAME: Aunt Becca
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w in aim, coaxed 4-3w 3/8, 3w uppr, steady off heels 3/16, wknd

ENTRY.NAME: L Street Lady
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-4w early, to ins 9/16,tip 3w 5/16, 4w uppr, rallied, up fin 70y

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: T & G Farm of Kentucky, LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Chocolate Gelato
ENTRY.COMMENT: brush gate, 5w early, to 2p 9/16, ins 1/4, tip 3-4w 3/16, wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Unified Alliance
ENTRY.COMMENT: 6w backstretch, 5-4w turn, 3w upper, up 3/16, caught late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 6 1 1/8M Inner turf CR: 88. Starter Allowance Purse 65000. INNER TURF (UP TO $11,310 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $50,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN OR CLAIMING. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-w inners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since December 1 Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PEGS A. K. GIRL went to the front, strolled around the first turn in the two path, was well rated while setting the pace on an easy lead, controlled the action while inside on the far turn, responded well when asked near the quarter-pole then came under a drive in upper stretch, fought off the runner-up in the final furlong and held sway under strong urging. ANILEATE had a shoe repaired in the paddock, went three wide on the first turn, stalked the pace on the outside, was let out in the two path on the far turn then asked for her best in upper stretch, fought outside of the winner to the finish and missed while able to get the place. EXCEPT TEMPTATION dropped back under snug restraint while in tight between foes in three path on the first turn, was rated off the pace, went three then four wide on the far turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive and finished willingly to just get the show. DONTMESSWITHTESS was fractious in the gate then charged the front of the stall again just before the start, came out at the rear of the field, tossed her head while rank against the hedge on the first turn, was reserved under tight restraint, saved ground on the far turn, was asked for her best in upper stretch and improved position to just miss the show. UP HER SLEEVE rounded the first turn in the two path, was reserved in behind cover, moved out from behind cover near the five-eighths, traveled around the far turn in the two path, was given her cue between foes at the quarter-pole, chased in the stretch and just missed the superfecta. CUMBERLAND FALLS was hard held in the three path going around the first turn, raced on the outside under reserve with cover, was forced out near the five-eighths, went four wide on the far turn, chased three wide into the stretch, pursued the winner in the drive and lacked the needed kick. DIVINE WINE was hard held along the hedge on the first turn then reserved off the pace, rounded the far turn in the two path, came under a drive in upper stretch, was taken in hand while lacking room behind horses in the final sixteenth and lost her chance at the minor awards. FREUDIAN tossed her head while rank in the four path on the first turn, was reserved off the pace, went three wide while let out on the far turn and lacked the needed response. FROM HELLO dropped to the rear of the field, raced under snug restraint in the two path going around the first turn, was unhurried at the back, came under urging in the two path on the far turn, moved to the three path late on that bend, spun five wide into the stretch and failed to threaten. ELECTORATE (IRE) rounded the first turn in the two path, was reserved towards the rear, came under urging leaving the backstretch, went thee then four wide on the far turn and failed to rally. ALWAYS LAUGHING was rated while well placed just off the pace on the inside, saved ground through the far turn and came up empty.

ENTRY.NAME: Dontmesswithtess
ENTRY.OWNER: Paradise Farms Corp and Staudacher David
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious gate,last away,rank 1st,toss head,ins turns,improved

ENTRY.NAME: Divine Wine
ENTRY.OWNER: Red Storm Stable and Stuchbury Gerard
ENTRY.COMMENT: hard held hedge1st,reserved,2p2nd,ask1/4,lckd room final 1/16

ENTRY.COMMENT: keen into 1st,2p,reserved at rear,roused 2-3p2nd,5w1/4,no threat

ENTRY.COMMENT: hard held 3p1st,reserved,forced out5/8,4w2nd,3w1/4,no kick

ENTRY.COMMENT: rated,well placed,inside turns,came up empty

ENTRY.COMMENT: tight btwn 3p1st,rated,3-4w2nd turn,chased,willingly for show

ENTRY.COMMENT: tossed head 1st turn,rank,4w,reserved,let out 3w2nd turn,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Electorate (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p1st,towards rear,asked 7/16,3-4w2nd turn,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Up Her Sleeve
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p1st,reserved,mvd out 5/8,tuck 2p2nd,ask1/4,missed super

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 7 5F Turf CR: 78. Maiden Special Weight Purse 90000. (UP TO $15,660 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race wi ll be run at Five Furlongs on the Main Track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AMIDST WAVES three then two wide in pursuit, got set down angled five wide into upper stretch, rallied to take command nearing the sixteenth marker and drew off to prevail going away at the end. KODIAC WINTERGREEN (IRE) coaxed from the gate, chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung three wide for home, ran on and was just up for the place honors in the very last jump to the finish. PRECISELY dueled from the two path briefly before taking to the inside, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in under a drive getting collared inside the eighth pole, kept on to the finish and was nailed for the place honors on the wire. MAYFLY hustled from the gate, dueled three then two wide, got let out spinning three to four wide into upper stretch, weakened in the final furlong. SMOOTH WAVES chased along the inside under coaxing from the three-eighths, spun two to three wide or home, offered no response. ROUND THE TOWN four then three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled six wide for home, weakened. BEADS coaxed from the gate, chased just off the inside and then along the inside under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside for home and weakened. DOZEN DIAMONDS broke in brushing the gate at the start, chased along the inside under a ride from the three-eighths, angled five to six wide into upper stretch and trailed.

ENTRY.COMMENT: brush gate, chased ins, coaxed 3/8, 5-6w upper, trailed

ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 3-2w, coaxed 3/8, 3w upper, ran on, up for 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 8 6F Dirt CR: 90. Starter Allowance Purse 65000. (UP TO $11,310 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $50,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN OR CLAIMING. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since Decembe r 1 Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NOLO CONTESTO pressed the pace on the outside, chased in the five path on the turn, pursued the pacesetter under a left-handed crop while still on his inside lead in upper stretch, made a bid outside the furlong marker, swapped to the proper lead outside the sixteenth-pole then reached even terms with the leader, fought with two foes to the finish and narrowly prevailed under strong urging. TENEBRIS broke out and bumped with a foe then was taken up while pulled off that foe with the left-rein, settled off the pace, went around most of the turn in the two path then shifted to the three path, was roused near the quarter-pole, paused behind the leader from the three-sixteenths to the eighth-pole, altered in for clear room at that juncture then rallied inside of the top two, closed well into the final sixteenth and just missed while clear for the show. WIN FOR GOLD went straight to the front, showed the way under some pressure while well off the rail, vied in the four path on the turn, responded well when asked for his best in upper stretch, led under a drive to the sixteenth-pole, battled with two opponents to the finish and just missed while clear for the show. INEVTABL CONECTION lost his footing some at the start then was bumped on both sides, pressed the pace on the inside of the leader, vied in the two path on the turn, dropped back under a drive into the final furlong and weakened. CHARGER bumped with a rival at the start, was urged along off the pace, went three wide on the turn, came four wide into the stretch and failed to rally. TURNSANDCONDITIONS was bumped on both sides at the start then stumbled and dropped back, went three wide on the turn and was no factor. BUILT TO LAST settled on the outside, dropped back while moving from the six path to the four path on the turn, floated six wide into upper stretch and had nothing left. DADS GOOD RUNNER was well placed just off the pace, made a bid along the rail on the turn, dropped back near the five-sixteenths and capitulated.

ENTRY.NAME: Dads Good Runner
ENTRY.COMMENT: just off pace,bid rail turn,dropped back 5/16,came up empty

ENTRY.NAME: Tenebris
ENTRY.OWNER: Tessore Bruno Proud Stable Inc and Preve Dominguez Camilo
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out,bmpd,tkn up,off pace,2-3p,pause behind foe3/16-1/8,rally

ENTRY.COMMENT: lost footing brk,bmp btwn,pressed ins leader,2p turn,wknd last1/8

ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd btwn brk,stumbled,at rear,3wide turn,no factor

ENTRY.OWNER: La Marca Stable and Rodriguez Rudy R
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,urged along,3wide turn,4w into lane,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Built to Last

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Tremont S. BELMONT PARK RACE 9 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 92. Stakes Purse 150000. FOR TWO-YEAR-OLDS. Non-Lasix Race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $150 each which should accompany the nomination; $750 to pass the entry box and an additional $750 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $750 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. NYRA will award $2,000 to all declared starters ($1,000 to the trainer and $1,000 to the owner) and a shipping bonus of $1,000 will be credited to the owners account for horses that are not stabled at a NYRA track (Belmont/Saratoga). Any horse that is placed on the Vets list or poor performance list will be ineligible for all awards. Weight, 122 lbs. Non winners of a race other than claiming or starter allowed 2 lbs. A trophy will be presen
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GOLD SWEEP coaxed from the gate, settled three wide in pursuit just off the top pair, continued three wide into upper stretch and was placed to urging taking over command straightened away, received three to four intermittent taps to the right shoulder and went clear and was under a hand ride through the final sixteenth to the finish. SHIP CADET hustled from the gate, pressed the pace of VITEMENT from the outside in the two path early on before advancing to duel from the three-eighths, took over narrow command with five-sixteenths to go, spun just off the inside into upper stretch under threat, was displaced from the front straightened away in the two path into upper stretch, proved no match for the top one while running on safe for the place honors. YO YO CANDY broke out at the start and was corrected, chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled out five wide into uppere stretch, kept on under a drive through the stretch to be along for the show honors well clear of the rest. FROSTY THE GIANT coaxed from the gate, chased just off the inside under coaxing from the three-eighths, angled six wide into upper stretch and weakened. JUMPINGJAGGERFLASH hustled from the start, chased two to three wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, continued two to three wide for home and tired. VITEMENT hustled from the gate, showed the way early on along the inside under pressure from SHIP CADET to the outside, got engaged in head to head combat with three furlongs to go, yielded command at the five-sixteenths and took the inside route into upper stretch under coaxing, then backed away and faltered in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Vitement
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, under pressure ins, duel from 3/8, ins 1/4, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Yo Yo Candy
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, chased ins, angled 5w upper, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Jumpingjaggerflash
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, chased 2-3w, coaxed 3/8, 2-3w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Ship Cadet
ENTRY.OWNER: Paradise Farms Corp Staudacher David Haynes Kevin and Huber John
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, pressed 2p early, dueled 3/8, up 5/16, 2w 1/4, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Gold Sweep
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, 3w off duel, 3w upper, went clear, handily

ENTRY.NAME: Frosty the Giant
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 2p, coaxed 3/8, angled 6w upper, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Wonder Again S. - Grade2 BELMONT PARK RACE 10 1 1/8M Inner turf CR: 95. Stakes Purse 200000. INNER TURF FOR FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PREREQUISITE was hustled to the front, dropped to the hedge entering the first turn, showed the way on the inside through solid fractions, shook clear when set down into upper stretch, was put to a right-handed crop outside the furlong marker, switched to a left-handed crop under threat from the runner-up late and just held under strong urging. BE YOUR BEST (IRE) tucked into the three path on the first turn, was reserved off the pace while on her own, moved closer while shifting from the two path to the four path on the final turn, was roused near the five-sixteenths, rallied into upper stretch, closed well to make a bid coming to the sixteenth-pole, fought with the winner to the finish and just missed while able to get the place. REVALITA (FR) leaned out at the start, rounded the first turn in the two path, settled towards the rear, went two then three wide on the far turn, was roused late on that bend, swung five wide into the stretch, rallied outside into the final furlong and finished willingly for the show. SPANSIVE dropped to the two path into the first turn, stalked the pace on the outside, vied in the two path on the far turn, was given her cue just inside the five-sixteenths, lost touch with the winner into upper stretch and was outfinished. ALLAMERICANBEAUTY was hustled from the gate then taken up under tight restraint nearing the first turn while beaten to the lead, saved ground while rated just off the pace in the second flight, came under urging on the far turn and lacked the needed response. THIRTY THOU KELVIN went three wide on the first turn, was rated outside in the second flight, traveled three wide around the far turn, was put to a drive in upper stretch and lacked the needed response. VENENCIA (FR) was off slow and spotted the front a few lengths, saved ground at the rear of the field, spun three wide into the stretch, was guided out outside the furlong marker then lugged in some under a left-handed crop and was no factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Allamericanbeauty
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,taken up into 1st,rated ins,asked 2nd turn,no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Revalita (FR)
ENTRY.COMMENT: leaned out brk,2p1st,towards rear,2-3p2nd,5w1/4,gain,willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Venencia (FR)
ENTRY.OWNER: Bradley Thoroughbreds Laura Leigh Stable Cone Jim Belmar Racing and Breeding LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slw,lagged at rear,ins trns,3w1/4,guided out,lug in,no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Prerequisite
ENTRY.OWNER: First Row Partners and Team Hanley
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,inside pace,asked1/4,shook clear,responded,held sway

ENTRY.NAME: Thirty Thou Kelvin
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3p1st,rated outside,3w2nd turn,lacked needed response

ENTRY.NAME: Be Your Best (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: tucked 3p1st,reserved,closer 2-4w2nd,rallied,bid,just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Spansive
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p1st,stalked outside,2p2nd,ask5/16,drop back into lane,outkicked

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 11 7F Turf CR: 70. Maiden Claiming Purse 45000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be V oid). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Seven Furlongs on the Main Track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WILLINTORISKITALL just off the inside off an early pace dispute, advanced to emerge from that quartet head to head with THE GOLDEN ONE five furlongs from home, knocked heads tucked inside through the turn coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, shook off his early pace rival and took the inside route into upper stretch, dug in bracing for the challenge of LAUREL VALLEY to the outside, got headed for command a furlong from home, fought on inside gamely to get the nod on the wire by a nostril. LAUREL VALLEY two to three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at near the quarter pole, swung three wide into upper stretch, rallied to take narrow command a furlong from home, dug in dueling through to the finish battling on gamely to the end but was ultimately bested on the wire. RIPE FOR MISCHIEF got bumped at the start by CONTROL ALT DELETE due to pressure from SIR LANCE, who broke outwards, advanced and vied briefly five wide outside a pair before being shaken off with five furlongs to go, tucked inside through the turn coming under coaxing near the five-sixteenths, took the inside route into upper stretch and ran on to secure the show honors. BANKINGONACHANCE chased three to four wide down the backstretch before tucking to the two path through the turn getting placed to coaxing with three furlongs to run, angled four wide into upper stretch and kept on to the finish. WAYWARD GHOST chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled six wide into upper stretch, improved position to the finish. SHARP PLAY BOY four to five wide in pursuit down the backstretch, tucked three wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, went seven wide into upper stretch and passed tired rivals. CONTROL ALT DELETE got bumped at the start by SIR LANCE and in turn bumped RIPE FOR MISCHIEF, chased four then three wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, angled four to five wide for home and offered no response. SIR LANCE broke out at the start bumping CONTROL ALT DELETE into RIPE FOR MISCHIEF, vied briefly four wide until shaken off five furlongs from home, tucked inside through the turn getting put to coaxing midway, continued along the inside route into upper stretch and tired. THE GOLDEN ONE vied early on three wide among a trio and then emerged to duel with WILLINTORISKITALL to his inside, tucked to the two path through the turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, continued just off the inside into upper stretch in the midst of being shaken off and tired in the drive. FORWARD CAST chased just off the inside until tucked inside through the turn, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled six to seven wide into upper stretch and tired. MR. MARLIN chased just off the inside under coaxing from the seven-sixteenths, angled five to six wide into upper stretch, made no impact. VOLCKER RULES chased just off the inside until tucked inside through the turn, came under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, spun three wide for home and never got involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Willintoriskitall
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p in aim, duel from 5/8, ins turn & 1/4, dueled str, gamely
